modules.description: This module defines command-line parameters and types for specifying input files, target architectures, and output configurations. It supports parsing and handling of options like architecture, bit width, endianness, and output formats for binary analysis tasks. Concrete use cases include configuring disassembly targets, setting binary parsing options, and directing output generation in BAP-based tools.

This module provides operations for binary disassembly, target configuration validation, and output format handling within the BAP framework. It works with memory representations, instruction sequences, and target specifications to support tasks like converting machine code to BIL/BIR, validating assembly representations, and constructing architecture-specific disassembly contexts. Key use cases include binary analysis workflows requiring precise instruction decoding, cross-format consistency checks, and configuration-driven disassembler setup.
